reviews.review_msg: Nice guy and genuinely cares about his students and the subject matter. LOTS of memorization for exam - easy to do well IF you have the time to revise, revise, revise! TMs are not great - unapproachable and a bit rude.

David himself is nice enough. Very approachable but the grading component of this class seemed random. The tutor markers are very pretty tough and some of the multiple choice questions are strangely phrased. I was never sure what my grade in this class was and didn't like not having a standard grading scale.

Just wanna add on to what I've said previously: althought the 2 midterms are extremely easy be prepared for the 12chapter cumulative final.. 130 multiple choice questions & the same amount of short answer. BRUTAL!
Amazing prof! Exams straight outta the textbook; study the bold definitions really well & you'll do fine. Probably the only class in my 3 years at SFU that I went to every single class!

If I had taken his course early on, it would have saved me a lot of time trying to decide on what I want to do. His erratic ramblings are very entertaining and his enthusiasm is infectious. Take this course if you are at ALL interested in health psych.
